Detailed Description

template<typename Resource>
class ResourceManager< Resource >

Provides the base functionality for Resource caching and access.

The ResourceManager gives some basic functionality to aid in resource management. It gives the user a basic method of caching, accessing, and clearing resources from the system. Loading a resource and registering it with the manager is left to the subclasses.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename Resource>
int ResourceManager< Resource >::resourcesLoaded (  )  const [inline]

Reports the number of resources (of type Resource) currently loaded in the system.

Returns:
The number of resources.

template<typename Resource>
void ResourceManager< Resource >::registerResource ( const std::string &  name,
Resource *  resource 
) [inline]

Register a new resource with the system. A name is not necessarily needed, but if none is given then there will be no way to again retrieve the Resource from here. This is useful in situations when the user wants to load something manually and will be maintaining the reference to the resource themselves but would still like the convenience of automatic deletion.

Parameters:
name The name to store the resource under. This name allows retrieval from the cache. If it is not unique, the previous resource will be replaced.
resource The actual resource to add to the cache.

template<typename Resource>
Resource * ResourceManager< Resource >::getCachedResource ( const std::string &  name  )  [inline]

Retrieves a Resource from the cache.

Parameters:
name The name the resource was stored under
Returns:
The cached Resource or null if nothing was found.

template<typename Resource>
void ResourceManager< Resource >::clearResources (  )  [inline, protected]

Removes all named and unnamed resources from the manager.
